text: Sir Antony Sher (14 June 1949 - 2 December 2021) was a South African-born British Drama Desk Award-winning actor, screenwriter, playwright, novelist and theatre director. He was born in Cape Town, South Africa. He has won two Laurence Olivier Award. He was known for his stage work with the Royal Shakespeare Company. In 2017, Prince Charles said that Sher as his favourite actor. Sher and his partner Gregory Doran became one of the first gay couples to enter into a civil partnership in the United Kingdom.BBC News, 21 December 2005. In September 2021, Sher was diagnosed with a terminal illness. He died of cancer three months later in Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwickshire on 2 December 2021, aged 72. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1949 births Category:2021 deaths Category:South African actors Category:British stage actors Category:British television actors Category:British LGBT people Category:LGBT actors Category:British voice actors Category:British movie actors Category:South African writers Category:British playwrights Category:British novelists Category:Gay men Category:Naturalised citizens of the United Kingdom Category:People from Cape Town Category:Drama Desk Award winners Category:British screenwriters Category:LGBT screenwriters Category:LGBT playwrights Category:LGBT novelists Category:British theatre directors Category:Laurence Olivier Award winners
